predict_diagnosis:
1. Hereditary spastic paraplegias (HSP) with associated extraparenchymal manifestations.
2. Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) with spinal cord involvement and plexiform neurofibromas causing neuropathy.
3. Mitochondrial myopathy with spastic paraplegia and neuropathic changes.
4. Adrenoleukodystrophy (ALD) with cerebral involvement and peripheral neuropathy.
5. Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT) with spastic paraplegia and decreased finger mobility.
6. Friedreich's ataxia with spastic paraplegia and hyperactive deep tendon reflexes.
7. Spinal cord infarction or ischemia leading to spastic paraplegia and neuropathic changes.
8. Arteriovenous malformation (AVM) of the spinal cord with associated hemangioma and spasticity.
9. Metabolic or storage disorder such as Krabbe disease or another leukodystrophy with neurologic symptoms.
10. Paraneoplastic syndrome due to an underlying malignancy with neuropathic changes and spastic paraplegia.
